title: How Do You Solve a Problem Like Georgetown Law?
sub_head: Libertarian scholar Ilya Shapiro saw he was being set up and left pre-emptively.
body:
Kudos to Ilya Shapiro for his decision to part company with Georgetown Law (“Why I Quit Georgetown,” op-ed, June 7). The hypocritical excesses and unforgivable spinelessness of the progressives running higher education have become so extreme as to have achieved a state of dark comedy—very dark comedy. Why would anyone sensible want anything to do with an organization so lacking in integrity as Georgetown Law?
It was wise of Mr. Shapiro to shake the dust off his feet and turn away from Georgetown Law as it sinks ever deeper into its echo chamber.
